item.title: Refining Humanism
item.description: In the previous post I mentioned the Humanism. Let's review its Manifesto #3. Knowledge of the world is derived by observation, experimentation, and rational analysis. That's alright. Except there's a new player now: the learning machines. So a bit snobbery “rational analysis” may be rephrased as the “processing and predicting”. I'm currently reading an amazing book on this topic: “The Most Human Human”. Humans are an integral part of nature, the result of unguided evolutionary change.
